description: The project will focus on provision of legal aid to the minority & vulnerable groups, training of lawyers and judges, rehabilitation/constructions of courts and prisons, address gender and human rights issues

subproject.corporate outcome: Effective, responsive, accessible and fair justice systems promote the rule of law, including both formal and informal processes, with due consideration on the rights of the poor, women and vulnerable groups
donor_long: United Nations Office on Drug and Crime
subproject.gender code: Gender equality as a significant objective
subproject.title: Access to Justice; Somaliland

subproject.corporate outcome: National, regional and local levels of governance expand their capacities to manage the equitable delivery of public services

subproject.description:
1.2.2 Improved capacity of religious and traditional authorities and civil society, particularly youth and women’s organizations to engage with government and participate in dialogue, conflict management and peace building processes. 

2.2.1 Improved functional capacities of public servants and institutions to design, enact, and implement public sector reforms including administrative law and process.

2.4.2 Improved credibility, efficacy and independence of the judicial system.

2.5.2 Establish and strengthen access to justice and legal empowerment for vulnerable groups including women and IDPs.
donor_long: United Nations Office on Drug and Crime
subproject.title: A2J Project Management
